Furthermore, World-Honored One!
When bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, they should contemplate thus:

In this way, when bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, they carefully observe that if a dharma is nonexistent and ungraspable, it is prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ. Within nonexistence and ungraspability, what can be questioned?
At that time, ÅšÄriputra asked SubhÅ«ti, saying:
What dharmas are nonexistent and ungraspable here?
SubhÅ«ti replied:

It means that the dharmas of the perfection of wisdom are non-existent and cannot be attained, and the dharmas of the perfections of meditative concentration, vigor, patience, morality, and giving are non-existent and cannot be attained.
Why is it so?

Because of inner emptiness, outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, absolute emptiness, emptiness without beginning or end, emptiness of dispersion, emptiness of inherent existence, emptiness of specific characteristics, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of nature, emptiness of intrinsic nature, and emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence.
ÅšÄriputra!
The dharmas of form are non-existent and cannot be attained, and the dharmas of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are non-existent and cannot be attained.
ÅšÄriputra!
the dharma of the eye sense field is non-existent and cannot be obtained, the dharma of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense fields is non-existent and cannot be obtained;
the dharma of the form sense field is non-existent and cannot be obtained, the dharma of the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma sense fields is non-existent and cannot be obtained.

The dharma of the eye element is non-existent and cannot be obtained, the dharma of the form element, eye consciousness element, eye contact, and the feelings produced from eye contact as a condition is non-existent and cannot be obtained;

the dharma of the ear element is non-existent and cannot be obtained, the dharma of the sound element, ear consciousness element, ear contact, and the feelings produced from ear contact as a condition is non-existent and cannot be obtained;

the dharma of the nose element is non-existent and cannot be obtained, the dharma of the smell element, nose consciousness element, nose contact, and the feelings produced from nose contact as a condition is non-existent and cannot be obtained;

the tongue element is non-existent and ungraspable, the taste element, the tongue consciousness element, and the contact, sensation, and craving associated with the tongue are non-existent and ungraspable;

the body element is non-existent and ungraspable, the tactile element, the body consciousness element, and the contact, sensation, and craving associated with the body are non-existent and ungraspable;

the mind element is non-existent and ungraspable, the dharma element, the mind consciousness element, and the contact, sensation, and craving associated with the mind are non-existent and ungraspable.
ÅšÄriputra!
the earth element is non-existent and ungraspable, the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements are non-existent and ungraspable.
ÅšÄriputra!
the noble truth of suffering is non-existent and ungraspable, the noble truths of the arising, cessation, and path of suffering are non-existent and ungraspable.
ÅšÄriputra!

The dharmas of ignorance are non-existent and cannot be attained, the dharmas of volitional formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, existence, birth, and old age and death are non-existent and cannot be attained.
ÅšÄriputra!

The dharmas of inner emptiness are non-existent and cannot be attained, the dharmas of outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, absolute emptiness, emptiness without beginning or end, emptiness of non-dispersal, emptiness of inherent existence, emptiness of specific characteristics, emptiness of general characteristics, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of intrinsic nature, emptiness of intrinsic nature of non-existence, and emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence of intrinsic nature are non-existent and cannot be attained.
ÅšÄriputra!

ÅšÄriputra!
the five eyes are non-existent and cannot be attained, the six supernormal powers are non-existent and cannot be attained.
ÅšÄriputra!

the four establishments of mindfulness are non-existent and cannot be attained, the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, and eightfold noble path are non-existent and cannot be attained.
ÅšÄriputra!

the ten powers of the Buddha are non-existent and cannot be attained, the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha, omniscience, knowledge of the path, and knowledge of all aspects are non-existent and cannot be attained.
ÅšÄriputra!

suchness is non-existent and cannot be attained, the dharma realm, dharma nature, dharma abiding, dharma determination, reality limit, equality, and detached nature are non-existent and cannot be attained.
ÅšÄriputra!
The dharmas of a stream-enterer are non-existent and cannot be attained, the dharmas of a once-returner, non-returner, arhat, pratyekabuddha are non-existent and cannot be attained.
ÅšÄriputra!
The dharmas of a bodhisattva are non-existent and cannot be attained, the dharmas of a tathÄgata are non-existent and cannot be attained.
ÅšÄriputra!
In brief, whether permanent or impermanent, whether blissful or painful, whether self or non-self,
whether pure or impure, whether empty or not empty, whether signless or with signs,
whether wishless or with wishes, whether tranquil or not tranquil, whether separated or
not separated, whether defiled or pure, whether arising or ceasing, whether conditioned or
unconditioned, whether with outflows or without outflows, whether wholesome or unwholesome, whether with offenses or
without offenses, whether worldly or supramundane, whether belonging to saá¹ƒsÄra or nirvÄá¹‡a,
whether past, future, or present, whether wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate,
whether bound to the desire realm, form realm, or formless realm, whether pertaining to training, post-training, or neither,
whether to be abandoned by seeing the truths, to be abandoned by cultivation, or not to be abandoned, whether
internal, external, or in between, such phenomena are all non-existent and cannot be apprehended.
Why is it so?

Because of inner emptiness, outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, emptiness of the ultimate, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, emptiness of the ultimate, emptiness without beginning or end, emptiness of dispersion, emptiness of immutability, emptiness of inherent nature, emptiness of specific characteristics, emptiness of general characteristics, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of nature, emptiness of self-nature, and emptiness of the nature of non-existence of self-nature.

If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ like this, when they carefully observe that all dharmas are non-existent and unobtainable, their minds do not become depressed or sorrowful, and their minds are not startled, frightened, or terrified. For this reason, it should be known that these bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas who practice the perfection of wisdom are always inseparable from the perfection of wisdom.
ÅšÄriputra!

Because these bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas, when practicing the perfection of wisdom, know that form is separate from the intrinsic nature of form, and know that feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are separate from the intrinsic nature of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness;

they know that the eye sense base is separate from the intrinsic nature of the eye sense base, and know that the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases are separate from the intrinsic nature of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases;
they know that the form sense base is separate from the intrinsic nature of the form sense base;
they know that the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma sense bases are separate from the intrinsic nature of the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma sense bases;

They know the eye element as it really is, apart from the intrinsic nature of the eye element. They know the form element, eye consciousness element, and eye contact, as well as the feelings produced by the condition of eye contact, as they really are, apart from the intrinsic nature of the form element up to the feelings produced by the condition of eye contact.

They know the ear element as it really is, apart from the intrinsic nature of the ear element. They know the sound element, ear consciousness element, and ear contact, as well as the feelings produced by the condition of ear contact, as they really are, apart from the intrinsic nature of the sound element up to the feelings produced by the condition of ear contact.

They know the nose element as it really is, apart from the intrinsic nature of the nose element. They know the smell element, nose consciousness element, and nose contact, as well as the feelings produced by the condition of nose contact, as they really are, apart from the intrinsic nature of the smell element up to the feelings produced by the condition of nose contact.

They know the tongue element as it really is, apart from the intrinsic nature of the tongue element. They know the taste element, tongue consciousness element, and tongue contact, as well as the feelings produced by the condition of tongue contact, as they really are, apart from the intrinsic nature of the taste element up to the feelings produced by the condition of tongue contact.

They know the body element as separate from the body element's own nature, and they know the touch element, the body consciousness element, and the body contact, as well as the feelings produced from the condition of body contact, as separate from the touch element up to the feelings produced from the condition of body contact's own nature;

They know the mind element as separate from the mind element's own nature, and they know the dharma element, the mind consciousness element, and the mind contact, as well as the feelings produced from the condition of mind contact, as separate from the dharma element up to the feelings produced from the condition of mind contact's own nature;

They know the earth element as separate from the earth element's own nature, and they know the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements as separate from the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements' own natures;

They know the noble truth of suffering as separate from the noble truth of suffering's own nature, and they know the noble truths of the arising, cessation, and path of suffering as separate from the noble truths of the arising, cessation, and path of suffering's own natures;

They know ignorance is separate from the nature of ignorance, and they know karmic formations, consciousness, name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress are separate from the nature of karmic formations up to old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, and distress.

They know inner emptiness is separate from the nature of inner emptiness, and they know outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, emptiness of conditioned phenomena, emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, absolute emptiness, emptiness without beginning or end, emptiness of non-abandonment, emptiness of essential nature, emptiness of specific characteristics, emptiness of all phenomena, emptiness of non-apprehension, emptiness of intrinsic nature, emptiness of intrinsic nature of non-existence, and emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence are separate from the nature of outer emptiness up to the intrinsic nature of non-existence.

They know the four concentrations are separate from the nature of the four concentrations, and they know the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations are separate from the nature of the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations.
They know that the five eyes are separate from the nature of the five eyes, and they know that the six supernormal knowledges are separate from the nature of the six supernormal knowledges;

They know that the four establishments of mindfulness are separate from the nature of the four establishments of mindfulness, and they know that the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, and eightfold noble path are separate from the nature of the four right efforts up to the eightfold noble path;

They know that the ten powers of the Buddha are separate from the nature of the ten powers of the Buddha, and they know that the four fearlessnesses, four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, eighteen distinctive abilities of the Buddha, all-inclusive knowledge, knowledge of the aspects of the path, and knowledge of all modes are separate from the nature of the four fearlessnesses up to the knowledge of all modes;

They know that suchness is separate from the nature of suchness, and they know that the dharma realm, dharma nature, abiding of dharmas, determination of dharmas, reality limit, equal nature, and unconditioned nature are separate from the dharma realm up to the unconditioned nature;

They know that the stream-enterer is separate from the intrinsic nature of the stream-enterer, and they know that the once-returner, non-returner, arhat, pratyekabuddha are separate from the intrinsic nature of the once-returner up to the pratyekabuddha;
They know that the bodhisattva is separate from the intrinsic nature of the bodhisattva, and they know that the TathÄgata is separate from the intrinsic nature of the TathÄgata;

They know that permanent and impermanent dharmas are separate from the intrinsic nature of permanent and impermanent dharmas, and they know that blissful and painful, having a self and being without a self, pure and impure, empty and not empty, having a sign and being signless, having a wish and being wishless, calm and not calm, isolated and not isolated, defiled and pure, arising and ceasing, conditioned and unconditioned, contaminated and uncontaminated, good and not good, having faults and being without faults, worldly and world-transcending, and dharmas belonging to saá¹ƒsÄra and nirvÄá¹‡a are separate from the intrinsic nature of blissful and painful up to dharmas belonging to saá¹ƒsÄra and nirvÄá¹‡a;

They know that past, future, and present dharmas are separate from the nature of past, future, and present dharmas. They know that wholesome, unwholesome, and indeterminate dharmas, dharmas bound to the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm, dharmas of learners, dharmas of non-learners, dharmas neither of learners nor non-learners, dharmas to be eliminated by seeing the truths, dharmas to be eliminated by cultivation, and dharmas not to be eliminated, dharmas within, without, and in the two intermediate directions are separate from the nature of wholesome, unwholesome, and indeterminate dharmas, up to dharmas within, without, and in the two intermediate directions.

For this reason, one should know that prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ is apart from the nature of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, dhyÄna, vÄ«rya, ká¹£Änti, Å›Ä«la, and dÄna-pÄramitÄ are apart from the nature of dhyÄna up to dÄna-pÄramitÄ, up to dharmas that are internal, external, or neither are apart from the nature of dharmas that are internal, external, or neither.

PrajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ is separated from the characteristics of prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ, and dhyÄna, vÄ«rya, ká¹£Änti, Å›Ä«la, and dÄna-pÄramitÄ are separated from the characteristics of dhyÄna up to dÄna-pÄramitÄ, up to dharmas that are inside, outside, or in-between are separated from the characteristics of dharmas that are inside, outside, or in-between.

Self-nature is also separated from self-nature, characteristics are also separated from characteristics, self-nature is also separated from characteristics, characteristics are also separated from self-nature, self-nature and characteristics are also separated from the self-nature and characteristics of characteristics, and the self-nature of characteristics is also separated from the self-nature and characteristics of self-nature.
At that time, ÅšÄriputra said to SubhÅ«ti,
If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas train in this, they will be able to accomplish omniscience.
SubhÅ«ti replied,ğŸ”½So it is!
So it is!
It is just as you have said.
If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas train in this, they will be able to accomplish omniscience.
Why is it so?
ÅšÄriputra!
This bodhisattva-mahÄsattva knows that all dharmas are unborn and unaccomplished.
ÅšÄriputra said:
For what causes and conditions are all dharmas unborn and unaccomplished?
SubhÅ«ti said:
Because form is empty, the accomplishment of the generation of form cannot be apprehended;
because feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are empty, the accomplishment of the generation of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness cannot be apprehended.
Because the eye sense base is empty, the accomplishment of the generation of the eye sense base cannot be apprehended;
because the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases are empty, the accomplishment of the generation of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind sense bases cannot be apprehended.
Because the form sense base is empty, the accomplishment of the generation of the form sense base cannot be apprehended;
because the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma sense bases are empty, the accomplishment of the generation of the sound, smell, taste, touch, and dharma sense bases cannot be apprehended.

Because the eye element, form element, eye consciousness element, eye contact, and the feelings produced by eye contact are empty, the production, completion, and non-completion of the eye element up to the feelings produced by eye contact cannot be apprehended.

Because the ear element, sound element, ear consciousness element, ear contact, and the feelings produced by ear contact are empty, the production, completion, and non-completion of the ear element up to the feelings produced by ear contact cannot be apprehended.

Because the nose element, smell element, nose consciousness element, nose contact, and the feelings produced by nose contact are empty, the production, completion, and non-completion of the nose element up to the feelings produced by nose contact cannot be apprehended.

Because the tongue element, taste element, tongue consciousness element, tongue contact, and the feelings produced by tongue contact are empty, the production, completion, and non-completion of the tongue element up to the feelings produced by tongue contact cannot be apprehended.

because the body element, the tangibility element, the body consciousness element, body contact, and the feelings produced by reason of body contact are empty, the production and completion of the body element, and so on, up to the feelings produced by reason of body contact cannot be apprehended.

because the mind element, the dharma element, the mind consciousness element, mind contact, and the feelings produced by reason of mind contact are empty, the production and completion of the mind element, and so on, up to the feelings produced by reason of mind contact cannot be apprehended.
because the earth element is empty, the production and completion of the earth element cannot be apprehended;
because the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements are empty, the production and completion of the water, fire, wind, space, and consciousness elements cannot be apprehended.
because the noble truth of suffering is empty, the production and completion of the noble truth of suffering cannot be apprehended;

because the noble truths of the arising of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path leading to the cessation of suffering are empty, the production and completion of the noble truths of the arising of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path leading to the cessation of suffering cannot be apprehended.
because ignorance is empty, the production and completion of ignorance cannot be apprehended;

because of the emptiness of volitional formations, up to the emptiness of old age and death, the accomplishment of the arising of volitional formations, up to old age and death, cannot be apprehended.
Because of the emptiness of emptiness, the accomplishment of the arising of emptiness cannot be apprehended;

because of the emptiness of external emptiness, internal and external emptiness, emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, conditioned emptiness, unconditioned emptiness, absolute emptiness, emptiness without beginning or end, emptiness of non-dispersal, emptiness of inherent nature, specific and general characteristics, all dharmas, non-apprehension, naturelessness, self-nature, and the naturelessness of self-nature, the accomplishment of the arising of external emptiness, up to the naturelessness of self-nature, cannot be apprehended.
Because of the emptiness of the four concentrations, the accomplishment of the arising of the four concentrations cannot be apprehended;
because the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations are empty, the accomplishment of the generation of the four immeasurables and four formless concentrations cannot be apprehended.
because the five eyes are empty, the accomplishment of the generation of the five eyes cannot be apprehended;
because the six supernormal knowledges are empty, the accomplishment of the generation of the six supernormal knowledges cannot be apprehended.
because the perfection of generosity is empty, the accomplishment of the generation of the perfection of generosity cannot be apprehended;

because the perfections of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom are empty, the accomplishment of the generation of the perfections of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom cannot be apprehended.
because the four establishments of mindfulness are empty, the accomplishment of the generation of the four establishments of mindfulness cannot be apprehended;

because the four right efforts, four bases of supernatural power, five faculties, five powers, seven factors of enlightenment, and eightfold noble path are empty, the accomplishment of the generation of the four right efforts, up to the eightfold noble path cannot be apprehended.
Because the ten powers of a buddha are empty, the accomplishment of the ten powers of a buddha cannot be apprehended;

because the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, great kindness, great compassion, great joy, great equanimity, the eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha, omniscience, the cognition of the path, and the cognition of all aspects are empty, the accomplishment of the four fearlessnesses up to the cognition of all aspects cannot be apprehended.
Because suchness is empty, the accomplishment of suchness cannot be apprehended;

because the dharma realm, dharma nature, dharma disposition, dharma fixation, reality limit, reality, and the nature of non-arising are empty, the accomplishment of the dharma realm up to the nature of non-arising cannot be apprehended.
Because a stream enterer is empty, the accomplishment of a stream enterer cannot be apprehended;
because a once-returner, non-returner, arhat, and pratyekabuddha are empty, the accomplishment of a once-returner up to a pratyekabuddha cannot be apprehended.
Because a bodhisattva is empty, the accomplishment of a bodhisattva cannot be apprehended;
Because the TathÄgata is empty, the TathÄgata's accomplishment of birth cannot be apprehended.
Because the dharmas of permanence and impermanence are empty, the accomplishment of the birth of the dharmas of permanence and impermanence cannot be apprehended;

Because the dharmas of pleasure and suffering, self and non-self, purity and impurity, emptiness and non-emptiness, sign and signless, wish and wishless, quiescence and non-quiescence, separation and non-separation, defilement and purity, arising and ceasing, conditioned and unconditioned, contaminated and uncontaminated, good and not good, blameworthy and blameless, worldly and world-transcending, and belonging to saá¹ƒsÄra and nirvÄá¹‡a are empty, the accomplishment of the birth of the dharmas of pleasure and suffering up to belonging to saá¹ƒsÄra and nirvÄá¹‡a cannot be apprehended.
Because past, future, and present dharmas are empty, the accomplishment of the birth of past, future, and present dharmas cannot be apprehended;

The emptiness of wholesome, unwholesome, and indeterminate dharmas, the emptiness of dharmas bound to the desire realm, form realm, and formless realm, the emptiness of dharmas of learners, adepts, and neither learners nor adepts, the emptiness of dharmas to be eliminated by seeing, cultivation, and not to be eliminated, the emptiness of dharmas internal, external, and neither internal nor external, the emptiness of the accomplishment and completion of dharmas - wholesome, unwholesome, and indeterminate, up to internal, external, and neither internal nor external dharmas cannot be apprehended.
ÅšÄriputra!
If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ in this way, they will approach omniscience.
As bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas approach omniscience in this way, they will attain purity of body, purity of speech, purity of mind, and purity of characteristics.

As a bodhisattva-mahÄsattva attains purity of body, speech, mind, and appearance, he does not give rise to a mind accompanied by greed, a mind accompanied by anger, a mind accompanied by delusion, a mind accompanied by pride, a mind accompanied by deceit and flattery, a mind accompanied by stinginess and jealousy, or a mind accompanied by any views.

Because this bodhisattva-mahÄsattva does not give rise to a mind accompanied by greed, up to a mind accompanied by any views, he will never fall into a woman's womb, will always be reborn by transformation, and will also never be reborn in any perilous or evil destinies.

Except for the causes and conditions of benefiting and bringing happiness to sentient beings, he will go from one buddha-land to another buddha-land, making offerings to, paying respects to, venerating, praising, and serving the Buddha Bhagavans, maturing sentient beings, purifying the buddha-land, up to attaining supreme perfect enlightenment, and will always be in the presence of the Buddha.
ÅšÄriputra!
If bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas wish to attain the above merits and benefits, they should study prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ and should not abandon it.

World-Honored One!

If one practices the signlessness or presence of signs of feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness, or the characteristics of the signlessness or presence of signs of feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness, it is not practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ.
If one practices the wishlessness or presence of wishes of form, or the characteristics of the wishlessness or presence of wishes of form, it is not practicing prajÃ±Ä-pÄramitÄ;
